metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3812 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAPdevice driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big)networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local userto crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
